title: Matrix Product States (MPS)
content:
Matrix Product States #  Origins: DMRG #  The Density Matrix Renormalization Group algorithm is a numerical method developed by Stephen White
Infinite DMRG #    Step 1: Superblock Hamiltonian #    \[H = - J \sum_{j=1}^N \sigma_j \sigma_{j+1} - h \sum_{j=1}^N \sigma_j\]      Step 2: Select target state #   \[H_{BB} = Q \Lambda Q^\dagger\]  Usually, the desired state is the ground state which corresponds to eigenstate with the lowest eigenvalue.  \[\Psi = Q(\min \lambda)\]  Step 3: Reduced density matrix #   \[\rho_{i j;i^\prime j^\prime} = \sum_{k,w} \Psi_{i,j,k,w} \Psi^*_{i^\prime,j^\prime,k,w}\]   \[\tilde\Psi_{ij}= \text{Tr}_{k,w}[\Psi_{ijkw}] % \to \rho = | \tilde\Psi \rangle \langle \tilde\Psi |\]   \[\rho_{i j;i^\prime j^\prime} = \sum_{k,w} (\text{Tr}_{ij}[\Psi_{ijkw}])^2 |\tilde\Psi_{ij} \rangle \langle \tilde\Psi_{ij} |\]  Step 4: Low-rank representation of the reduced density matrix #   \[\rho = U \Lambda U^\dagger\]   \[\Lambda_{ij} = \lambda_i \delta_{ij}\]   \[\Lambda_{ij} = \begin{cases} \lambda_i &\text{if } i = j \\ 0 &\text{otherwise} \end{cases}\]   \[\tilde\Lambda_{ij} = \begin{cases} \lambda_i &\text{if } i = j \land i \leq m \\ 0 &\text{otherwise} \end{cases}\]   \[H_B = \tilde{U}_{ij} = U_{ij}\]  Finite DMRG #
